title: Walmarts Black Friday sale is still live — find all the best deals heading into Cyber Monday
description: The best deals from Walmart's Black Friday deals event include an Apple Watch SE ($149), a 55-inch Roku TV ($178), and JLab headphones ($29).
excerpt: Our favorite TV doorbuster deal is back in stock.
text: Credit: Stacey Zhu / Walmart / Mashable composite Table of Contents The best Black Friday deals still live at Walmart: Walmart's second Black Friday Deals event kicked off on Monday, Nov. 25 with a $178 55-inch 4K Roku TV, $29 JBL noise-cancelling headphones, and new record-low prices on several Apple gadgets.We expect most of these deals to be available online through Sunday, Dec. 1, unless they sell out first — though a few items that disappeared earlier in the week are back in stock at the time of writing. That includes $30 digital copies of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom and a $49 Nintendo Switch Pro Controller. Mashable's team of deal-hunting pros knows how to distinguish good discounts from duds (having covered Black Friday sales for nearly a decade), and we're keeping a running list of Walmart's top holiday deals on popular tech and gifts this season. That includes TVs, laptops, headphones, gaming gear, vacuums, beauty tech, and Legos.Keep scrolling to see our picks — and check back often, as Walmart is dropping additional deals randomly as its Black Friday Deals event progresses. A quick FYI that Walmart doesn't do price matches, but its extended return/exchange policy is in effect through Dec. 31. It covers most items purchased in stores and online.Note: All newly added or updated deals have been marked with a ✨, while struck-through deals were sold out at the time of writing.Best Apple Deal Why we like it:Walmart has been a trendsetter this Black Friday. The retailer's Black Friday sale kicked off with this show-stopping deal on Apple AirPods Pro 2, bringing them down to $154. Other retailers followed suit, matching the price on these top-rated AirPods. The AirPods Pro 2 provide a more secure fit than the standard AirPods, thanks to a rubber tip that keeps them in place. Plus, these AirPods were the first to have ANC, and now they're equipped with a hearing aid feature.More Apple deals at Walmart:AirPodsApple AirPods (2nd Gen) — $89 $129 (save $40)iPadsApple iPad, 10.9-inch (A14 Bionic, WiFi, 64GB SSD) — $259 $349 (save $90)MacBooksApple MacBook Air, 13-inch (M1, 8GB RAM, 256GB SSD) — $599 Apple WatchApple Watch Series 10 (42mm, GPS) — $329 $399 (save $70)Apple Watch Series 10 (46mm, GPS) — $359 $429 (save $70)Apple accessoriesApple 20W USB-C Power Adapter — $9 $19 (save $10)Apple Pencil (1st Gen) — $59 $99 (save $40)Apple AirTags (4-pack) — $72.99 $99 (save $26.01)iPhone casesOtterBox Defender Series Pro Case for MagSafe (Apple iPhone 16) — $19 $64.95 (save $45.95)OtterBox Defender Series Pro Case for MagSafe (Apple iPhone 16 Plus) — $19 $64.95 (save $45.95)OtterBox Defender Series Pro Case for MagSafe (Apple iPhone 16 Pro) — $19 $64.95 (save $45.95)OtterBox Defender Series Pro Case for MagSafe (Apple iPhone 16 Pro Max) — $19 $64.95 (save $45.95)OtterBox Defender Series Pro Case (Apple iPhone 15 Pro Max) — $19 $64.95 (save $45.95)OtterBox Defender Series Pro Case (Apple iPhone 15/14/13) — $19 $64.95 (save $45.95)OtterBox Defender Series Pro Case (Apple iPhone 14 Pro Max) — $19 $64.95 (save $45.95)OtterBox Defender Series Pro Case (Apple iPhone 13 Pro Max/12 Pro Max) — $19 $64.95 (save $45.95)OtterBox Defender Series Pro Case (Apple iPhone 12/12 Pro) — $19 $64.95 (save $45.95)OtterBox Defender Series Pro Case (Apple iPhone 11) — $19 $64.95 (save $45.95)Best TV deal Why we like it:Walmart is famous for its Black Friday TV doorbusters, and this year the big-box store went hard. Live Latest Updates 51 minutes ago | December 1, 2024 Our top Apple deal at Walmart, the Apple Watch SE, has gone out of stock. However, you can still find savings on the Apple AirPods Pro 2, which are down to the impressive price of $154, saving you $95. 1 hour ago | November 30, 2024 3 hours ago | November 30, 2024 Blend smoothies, make cookie dough, or chop ingredients with the Ninja Grand Kitchen System. This blender comes with a large 72-ounce pitcher, an 8-cup food processor bowl, and an 18-ounce single-serve blending cup. It's a true kitchen multi-tasker and it's on sale for $98, saving you $71. 6 hours ago | November 30, 2024 7 hours ago | November 30, 2024 Best TV Deal: After selling out on Black Friday proper, one of Walmart's top doorbuster TV deals is back in stock online. Snag the 55-inch Hisense R6 4K Roku TV on sale at Walmart for just $178 (normally $278). It's the cheapest 55-incher we've spotted anywhere. 9 hours ago | November 30, 2024 As of Saturday, Nov. 30, Walmart's best deals on Apple products are still available and in stock. You can still score record-low prices on past-gen Apple products, including AirPods Pro 2 earbuds for $154, Apple Watch SE (GPS) for $149, and the AirPods 2 wireless earbuds for only $89. The deal on the AirPods 2 is a Walmart exclusive, and we've seen them going in and out of stock over the past 24 hours. 11 hours ago | November 30, 2024 12 hours ago | November 30, 2024 15 hours ago | November 30, 2024 15 hours ago | November 30, 2024 Best Apple Watch Deal: You can still get the Apple Watch SE (2nd Gen) for under $150 at Walmart. The retailer has everyone else beat on the price of the smaller 40mm model except for Amazon, which is matching its $100 discount during its own Black Friday sale. Frequently Asked Questions Walmart's online Black Friday sale ends on Saturday, Nov. 30. However, we've got good news for procrastinators. While the sale ends on Saturday, Walmart's Cyber Monday sale begins on Sunday, Dec. 1. While top doorbuster deals are already sold out (sorry, Nintendo Switch and Mario Kart fans), there will still be plenty of deals to shop through Cyber Monday. This year, Walmart joined other major retailers like Amazon, Best Buy, and Target in dropping Black Friday deals well ahead of the actual holiday. It launched its first round of doorbusters on Nov. 11.Walmart's first Black Friday Deals event was live online from Monday, Nov. 11 through Sunday, Nov. 17, popping up in stores on Friday, Nov. 15. The sale included doorbusters like a $138 50-inch 4K TV, a $378 75-inch 4K TV, heavily discounted refurbished Dyson hair tools (which sold out fast), a $30 Keurig, $69 Beats headphones, and all-time lows on the new Apple Watch Series 10, the AirPods 3, the Apple AirTag, and the Dyson V12 Detect Slim. (That's Mashable's favorite Dyson vacuum.) Walmart will conclude its holiday programming with a Cyber Monday sale that starts on Sunday, Dec. 1 at 5 p.m. ET for Walmart+ members and 8 p.m. ET for everyone else. That event will run through Cyber Monday proper on Dec. 2 and feature the following deals, among many others:Sony 75-inch Class Bravia 4K TV — $898 $1,498 (Save $600)Ninja Grand Kitchen System 1200 — $98 (Special Buy)Cricut Air 2 Bundle — $179 $269 (save $90)Intex 6-Person PureSpa Inflatable Hot Tub Spa Set — $499.99 $749.99 (save $250)Lego Star Wars Darth Vader Helmet — $48.98 $79.99 (save $31.01) Haley Henschel is a Chicago-based Senior Shopping Reporter at Mashable who reviews and finds deals on popular tech, from laptops to gaming consoles and VPNs. She has years of experience covering shopping holidays and can tell you what’s actually worth buying on Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day. Her work has also explored the driving forces behind digital trends within the shopping sphere, from dupes to 12-foot skeletons.Haley received a B.A. in Journalism from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and honed her sifting and winnowing skills at The Daily Cardinal. She previously covered politics for The Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, investigated exotic pet ownership for Wisconsin Watch, and blogged for some of your favorite reality stars.In her free time, Haley enjoys playing video games, drawing, taking walks on Lake Michigan, and spending time with her parrot (Melon) and dog (Pierogi). She really, really wants to get back into horseback riding. You can follow her on X at @haleyhenschel or reach her via email at [email protected]. The best Black Friday Apple deals in 2024 — deep price cuts are still live Cyber Monday is already on at Amazon, and some Black Friday deals are still lingering Tons of Black Friday streaming deals end soon. Don't miss offers from Hulu, Peacock, Max, and Prime Video. html:
Credit: Stacey Zhu / Walmart / Mashable composite

Table of Contents

The best Black Friday deals still live at Walmart:

Walmart's second Black Friday Deals event kicked off on Monday, Nov. 25 with a $178 55-inch 4K Roku TV, $29 JBL noise-cancelling headphones, and new record-low prices on several Apple gadgets.

We expect most of these deals to be available online through Sunday, Dec. 1, unless they sell out first — though a few items that disappeared earlier in the week are back in stock at the time of writing. That includes $30 digital copies of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom and a $49 Nintendo Switch Pro Controller.

Mashable's team of deal-hunting pros knows how to distinguish good discounts from duds (having covered Black Friday sales for nearly a decade), and we're keeping a running list of Walmart's top holiday deals on popular tech and gifts this season. That includes TVs, laptops, headphones, gaming gear, vacuums, beauty tech, and Legos.

Keep scrolling to see our picks — and check back often, as Walmart is dropping additional deals randomly as its Black Friday Deals event progresses. A quick FYI that Walmart doesn't do price matches, but its extended return/exchange policy is in effect through Dec. 31. It covers most items purchased in stores and online.

Note: All newly added or updated deals have been marked with a ✨, while struck-through deals were sold out at the time of writing.

Best Apple Deal

Why we like it:

Walmart has been a trendsetter this Black Friday. The retailer's Black Friday sale kicked off with this show-stopping deal on Apple AirPods Pro 2, bringing them down to $154. Other retailers followed suit, matching the price on these top-rated AirPods.

The AirPods Pro 2 provide a more secure fit than the standard AirPods, thanks to a rubber tip that keeps them in place. Plus, these AirPods were the first to have ANC, and now they're equipped with a hearing aid feature.

More Apple deals at Walmart:

Best TV deal

Why we like it:

Walmart is famous for its Black Friday TV doorbusters, and this year the big-box store went hard. This is simply the cheapest TV deal we're currently seeing in the 55-inch size category, and the competition is pretty darn strong. Best Buy's least-expensive contender is $219.99, while Amazon's low-end option costs $299.99 — though both of those models have nicer, brighter QLED displays.

Walmart also has a 55-inch QLED Roku TV on sale for $288 (normally $348). Best Buy's cheaper QLED model is a Google TV, so the one you ultimately add to your cart will come down to your smart TV platform preference.

More TV deals at Walmart:

  • TCL 55-inch Class QM7 Mini-LED 4K Google TV — $569.95 $1,099.99 (save $530)

Best gaming deal

Why we like it:

Read Mashable's full review of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom.

The stunning sequel to Breath of the Wild was one of Mashable's favorite games of 2023, and it's never been this cheap before. (It actually sold out once at this price earlier in the week; it was back in stock at the time of writing.) Note that Walmart's deal applies to both physical and digital copies of ToTK, so you can opt for something to wrap or something to start playing right away.

Best headphone/earbud deal

Why we like it:

Full disclosure: Our initial reaction to seeing this deal was, "Is this allowed? " Twenty-nine bucks is a surprisingly and stupidly low price on a solid pair of comfy budget headphones with good noise cancellation and a long battery life. (JLab has rated them at up to 70 hours; we're currently testing them and feel like that's accurate.) Elsewhere, the JBuds Lux ANC are going for $46.99 at Amazon and $49.99 on the JLab website, so no idea how Walmart finagled this one.

Frequently Asked Questions

Walmart's online Black Friday sale ends on Saturday, Nov. 30. However, we've got good news for procrastinators. While the sale ends on Saturday, Walmart's Cyber Monday sale begins on Sunday, Dec. 1. While top doorbuster deals are already sold out (sorry, Nintendo Switch and Mario Kart fans), there will still be plenty of deals to shop through Cyber Monday.

This year, Walmart joined other major retailers like Amazon, Best Buy, and Target in dropping Black Friday deals well ahead of the actual holiday. It launched its first round of doorbusters on Nov. 11.

Walmart's first Black Friday Deals event was live online from Monday, Nov. 11 through Sunday, Nov. 17, popping up in stores on Friday, Nov. 15. The sale included doorbusters like a $138 50-inch 4K TV, a $378 75-inch 4K TV, heavily discounted refurbished Dyson hair tools (which sold out fast), a $30 Keurig, $69 Beats headphones, and all-time lows on the new Apple Watch Series 10, the AirPods 3, the Apple AirTag, and the Dyson V12 Detect Slim. (That's Mashable's favorite Dyson vacuum.)

Walmart will conclude its holiday programming with a Cyber Monday sale that starts on Sunday, Dec. 1 at 5 p.m. ET for Walmart+ members and 8 p.m. ET for everyone else. That event will run through Cyber Monday proper on Dec. 2 and feature the following deals, among many others:

  • Sony 75-inch Class Bravia 4K TV — $898 $1,498 (Save $600)

  • Ninja Grand Kitchen System 1200 — $98 (Special Buy)

  • Cricut Air 2 Bundle — $179 $269 (save $90)

  • Intex 6-Person PureSpa Inflatable Hot Tub Spa Set — $499.99 $749.99 (save $250)

  • Lego Star Wars Darth Vader Helmet — $48.98 $79.99 (save $31.01)

Haley Henschel is a Chicago-based Senior Shopping Reporter at Mashable who reviews and finds deals on popular tech, from laptops to gaming consoles and VPNs. She has years of experience covering shopping holidays and can tell you what’s actually worth buying on Black Friday and Amazon Prime Day. Her work has also explored the driving forces behind digital trends within the shopping sphere, from dupes to 12-foot skeletons.

Haley received a B.A. in Journalism from the University of Wisconsin-Madison and honed her sifting and winnowing skills at The Daily Cardinal. She previously covered politics for The Milwaukee Journal Sentinel, investigated exotic pet ownership for Wisconsin Watch, and blogged for some of your favorite reality stars.

In her free time, Haley enjoys playing video games, drawing, taking walks on Lake Michigan, and spending time with her parrot (Melon) and dog (Pierogi). She really, really wants to get back into horseback riding. You can follow her on X at @haleyhenschel or reach her via email at [email protected].
